newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: South African Reserve Bank supporting rand-dealers.
newsitem.headline: South African Reserve Bank supporting rand-dealers.

text.p: The South African Reserve Bank (SARB) was active in the foreign exchange market on Thursday, capping rand weakness against the U.S. dollar caused by sizeable importer orders, dealers said.
"The Reserve Bank has been out there offering liquidity at 4.4900," one dealer said.

The local unit recovered early Thursday from yesterday's nervous session, but large importer dollar orders, said to be 100 million-400 million rand in total, sent it from a morning best of 4.4765 hurtling toward 4.4900.
The slide versus the dollar was arrested several times over the day by the Reserve Bank offering additional supplies of the greenback, traders said.
